This work explores the educational potential of film as a tool for enhancing learning across various subjects, advocating for its inclusion in educational settings and libraries. Wrigley emphasizes the significant role that cinema can play in making education more engaging and effective.  The opening of the book presents a foreword by Sir Gilbert Parker, highlighting the undeniable benefits of using films to teach subjects like geography, science, and literature across schools.
